metadata.title: AI-Enhanced ML-FAANG Mastery Plan
metadata.description: 20-week comprehensive roadmap for ML researchers transitioning to FAANG software engineering roles with AI-powered learning assistance

phases.name: Foundation & Basic Patterns
phases.description: Master fundamental data structures and algorithms with AI coaching

phases.name: Advanced Data Structures
phases.description: Deep dive into complex data structures and tree algorithms

phases.name: Advanced Algorithms & System Design
phases.description: Master complex algorithmic concepts and ML system design

phases.name: Company-Specific Preparation
phases.description: Company-focused preparation and advanced interview techniques

phases.name: Interview Mastery & Specialization
phases.description: Final preparation with mock interviews and specialization

saturday.title: Portfolio Project: Real-Time Anomaly Detection System
saturday.description: Build a system to detect anomalies in streaming data using advanced hashing and array techniques. The system will be designed to handle high-throughput data streams, a common requirement in FAANG-level production environments. You will use AI to help design the data structures, optimize the algorithms, and generate test cases with various anomaly patterns.

problems.name: Sliding Window Maximum
problems.description: Apply sliding window with deque to streaming anomaly data

problems.name: Contains Duplicate II
problems.description: Detect duplicates within a moving window of k

problems.name: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
problems.description: Classic sliding window for unique substring length

tasks: Design a custom hash function for streaming data elements with AI guidance.
Implement a rolling hash to efficiently compare sliding windows of data.
Develop a system to flag statistical anomalies (e.g., sudden changes in mean or variance) in real-time.
Use AI to generate a synthetic data stream with injected anomalies for robust testing.
saturday.deliverable: A GitHub repository with the complete project, a detailed README explaining the design and performance, and a demonstration script.

sunday.title: Advanced ML System Study & Week 2 Prep
sunday.description: Deep dive into the architecture of a large-scale content recommendation system like Netflix's, focusing on how data structures from this week are used for candidate generation and filtering. Use AI to simulate architectural discussions and trade-off analysis.
tasks: Map out the data flow in the Netflix recommendation pipeline with AI assistance.
Analyze how hash-based techniques are used for efficient candidate retrieval from a massive content catalog.
Use an AI partner to debate the pros and cons of different data structures for storing user profiles and content metadata.
Prepare for Week 2 by using AI to generate a summary of Two Pointer techniques and their applications in ML.
sunday.deliverable: A detailed markdown document in your GitHub repo summarizing the Netflix system analysis and your architectural insights.

ai_prompts.text: Help me configure the optimal AI-enhanced development environment for ML engineering interviews. Include VS Code extensions, AI tools (Claude, GPT-4, Copilot), and custom prompt templates for connecting DS&A to ML systems.

Explain how hash tables relate to my ML background - embedding lookups, attention mechanisms, vocabulary mappings in transformers. Provide coding examples connecting Two Sum to transformer operations.
Create a personalized study plan based on my ML research background. Identify knowledge gaps in DS&A and suggest optimal learning sequence for FAANG interviews with AI assistance.

saturday.description: Build an interactive tool that visualizes the behavior of various sliding window algorithms in real-time. This project will demonstrate your deep understanding of the pattern and your ability to build sophisticated, educational tools.
